questions.question: A large firm may experience diseconomies of scale if there is
questions.optiond: decrease in the cost of production
questions.correction: Diseconomies of scale occur when a firm or business grows so big that the costs per unit of output increase. If the firm becomes so large that it can no longer efficiently coordinate production activities, it will most likely experience diseconomies of scale.

questions.correction: Increasing returns to scale is when the output increases in a greater proportion than the increase in input.

questions.question: Which function of the wholesaler enables him to stabilize prices?
questions.correction: One function of the Wholesaler is that he serves as a warehouse for the manufacturer. The wholesaler provides warehousing facilities to get rid of stockpiling at the production point. Goods are stored at the warehouse until they are bought, hence it gives the wholesaler an edge in the bargaining power of the products. He can decide to keep the goods as long as possible and sell them at a price he considers considerable.

questions.question: In the long run, as individuals receive higher wages, it causes
questions.optionc: supply of normal goods to decrease

questions.question: Labor productivity is defined as
questions.optionc: the maximum number of hours Worked
questions.correction: Labor productivity measures the hourly output of a country's economy

Import substitution as a strategy of industrialization is the
questions.optiona: replacement of locally produced goods with imported ones
questions.optionb: development of locally produced goods with imported ones
questions.optionc: establishment of firms to process imported raw materials
questions.optiond: act of using local inputs to produce goods for export

questions.question: Which of the following are intermediate products?
questions.correction: Intermediate goods are products that are used in the production process to make other goods or further production. Cement and steel from option A above are examples of intermediate goods, as they are used in building and construction.

questions.question: How is NNP at factor cost derived from GNP at market prices?
Inflation may occur if
questions.optiona: rate of productivity is higher than the wage rate
questions.optionb: prices fluctuate during a particular season of the year
questions.optionc: wage increase is granted without an increase in productivity
questions.optiond: the government embarks on restrictive monetary policies

questions.question: Money would cease to be a good store of value when
questions.optiona: prices of goods and services are falling slowly
questions.optionb: there is a high level of unemployment
questions.optionc: prices of goods and services are rising rapidly
questions.optiond: prices of go0ds and services are rising slowing
questions.correction: Money is considered a store of value, where it can be used as a means of saving and allocating capital. Where the value of goods and services is on the rise, the purchasing power of money drops. With this, the value of the money that was stored years back will no longer have the same value due to the change in the prices of commodities.

questions.question: Which of the following factors may lead to the underestimation of national income figures?
questions.optionc: Emigration of skilled workers to foreign countries

questions.question: Governments in West Africa can curtail inflation by
questions.optiona: purchasing securities in the open market
questions.optionb: selling securities in the open market
questions.optionc: encouraging importation of goods from all countries
questions.correction:
Inflation is simply when excess money is used in buying few goods. This could be as a result of high wages with no matching productivity. When people have excess money available for spending, their purchasing power will be high, as they will be willing to pay any amount to get goods (which are in limited supply) in this case.

The government can curtail inflation by raising the level of output/production and taking out the excess money in circulation in the economy. This is done through the sale of securities at high-interest rates. When people realize that, the government is offering to sell securities and the interest paid on the securities is high, they will be willing to buy from the government. With this, they are less money available for spending as many people may have invested their excess monies with the government through the purchase of securities.

questions.question: The central bank Can reduce the ability of commercial banks to give out loans by
Tools of monetary policy do not include
questions.correction: Central banks have four main monetary policy tools: the reserve requirement, open market operations, the discount rate, and interest on reserves.

questions.question: During inflation, the appropriate fiscal measure to adopt is to
questions.correction:
In fiscal policy, the government controls inflation either by reducing private spending or by decreasing government expenditure, or using both.

It reduces private spending by increasing taxes on private businesses. When private spending is more, the government reduces its expenditure to control inflation. The tax system should provide larger incentives to those who save, invest, and produce more.

questions.question: Mr. X and Mrs. Y pay $500.00 and $1,400.00 as taxes on their earning of S5,000.00 and $7,000.00 respectively. The system of taxation employed is
questions.correction: A progressive tax is a type of tax in which the tax rate increases as the taxable amount increases. This type of taxes imposes a greater percentage of taxation on higher income levels

questions.question: A country is allowed to import just 50,000 tonnes of rice annually. This describes
Dumping is selling goods in a foreign market at a price
questions.optiona: below what is sold at the home market
questions.optionb: above what is sold at the home market.
questions.optionc: equal to what is sold at the home market
questions.optiond: equal to the cost of producing the goods
questions.correction: In international trade, dumping simply refers to a situation where a product is sold at a cheaper price to a foreign country (importing country), than in the domestic market that produced it (exporting country).

questions.question: The principle of comparative advantage encourages a country to
questions.optionb: engage in trade if it can produce a commodity at a lower cost
questions.optionc: specializes in the production of all goods
questions.optiond: try as much as possible to be self-sufficient

questions.question: The foremost objective of the International Bank of Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is to
questions.optiona: help promote private and public investments
questions.optionb: assist members achieve a balance of payments stability
questions.optionc: grant long term loans for infrastructure
questions.correction: The major objective of the International Bank of Reconstruction and Development is to provide long-term capital to members countries for economic reconstruction and development.

questions.question: In order to discourage the importation of manufactured goods, a country should adopt
questions.correction: Import substitution industrialization is the idea that blocking imports of manufactured goods can help an economy by increasing the demand for domestically produced goods.

questions.question: Free trade is one in which
questions.optiona: each member operates its own barriers against non-members
questions.optionc: members adopt a common external tariff against non- members
questions.optiond: members adopt common fiscal and economic policies
questions.correction: Free trade is a trade policy where goods and services can be bought and sold across international borders with little or no government tariffs, quotas, subsidies.

questions.question: The exploitation of mineral resources constitutes which form of production?
questions.correction: Primary production involves the exploration and extraction of raw materials.
